headline.seo: Life Expectancy for Less Educated Whites in U.S. Is Shrinking
headline.print_headline: Reversing Trend, Life Span Shrinks for Some Whites
headline.main: Life Spans Shrink for Least-Educated Whites in the U.S.

docs.abstract: Research study highlights mounting evidence that the enduring trend that children would outlive their parents has reversed itself for country’s least-educated whites, an increasingly troubled group whose life expectancy has fallen by four years since 1990; reasons remain unclear but some possible explanations include a spike in prescription drug overdoses and higher rates of smoking.
docs.lead_paragraph: A long rise in Americans’ life spans has reversed itself for white people who lack high school diplomas, an increasingly troubled group that has lost four years of life expectancy since 1990.
docs.snippet: A long rise in Americans’ life spans has reversed itself for white people who lack high school diplomas, an increasingly troubled group that has lost four years of life expectancy since 1990.

headline.seo: Poor Families Happier, If Not Wealthier, in New Neighborhoods
headline.print_headline: Intangible Dividend of Antipoverty Effort: Happiness
headline.main: Intangible Dividend of Antipoverty Effort: Happiness

docs.abstract: Scientists find that thousands of poor families who were given federal housing subsidies in the early 1990s to move out of impoverished neighborhoods did not get better jobs or higher incomes, but their lives had improved in another way--they are happier; their level of happiness can even be quantified as equal to someone whose annual income was $13,000 more a year.
docs.lead_paragraph: Poor families given federal housing subsidies in the 1990s to move out of poor neighborhoods did not end up with better jobs and more education, as social scientists had expected.
docs.snippet: Poor families given federal housing subsidies in the 1990s to move out of poor neighborhoods did not end up with better jobs and more education, as social scientists had expected.

docs.abstract: Research shows that some foods really are addictive.
docs.snippet: Research shows that some foods really are addictive.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the news: birth control, vaccines and the obesity paradox. Test your knowledge of this week’s health news.
docs.snippet: In the news: birth control, vaccines and the obesity paradox. Test your knowledge of this week’s health news.

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by historian Martin Bruegel holds the notion of using 'scientific' knowledge to guide dietary habits of people, which is behind new mandates for chain restaurants to post calorie information on their menus, is quite old; says fate of earlier campaigns suggests that it will take more than simply giving people more nutritional information to combat the rising rates of obesity.
docs.lead_paragraph: The fate of earlier campaigns suggests that it will take much more than calorie information to change the way people eat.
docs.snippet: The fate of earlier campaigns suggests that it will take much more than calorie information to change the way people eat.

headline.seo: More Data Suggests Fitness Matters More Than Weight
headline.print_headline: In ‘Obesity Paradox,’ Thinner May Mean Sicker
headline.main: In ‘Obesity Paradox,’ Thinner May Mean Sicker

docs.abstract: Researchers have been puzzled by phenomenon known as the obesity paradox, in which overweight or obese patients with certain chronic diseases live longer and fare better than normal-weight patients with the same ailments; evidence is inspiring some experts to re-examine assumptions about the role of body fat in relation to these diseases.
docs.lead_paragraph: A slow but steady accumulation of evidence is inspiring some experts to re-examine assumptions about the role of body fat in certain chronic diseases.
docs.snippet: A slow but steady accumulation of evidence is inspiring some experts to re-examine assumptions about the role of body fat in certain chronic diseases.

docs.abstract: A mysterious disease strikes farm workers in Andhra Pradesh, Sri Lanka and Nicaragua, investigation finds.

headline.seo: Championing a Farm to Table Movement in Texas
headline.print_headline: Championing the Farm to Table Food Movement
headline.main: Championing the Farm to Table Food Movement

docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Eddie Rodriguez of Austin, a Democrat, has been joined by Republicans to reduce restrictions on the local production of healthy food.
docs.snippet: Representative Eddie Rodriguez of Austin, a Democrat, has been joined by Republicans to reduce restrictions on the local production of healthy food.
